meanings.definition: A person sent on a religious mission.
meanings.sent1: The apostle traveled far to spread his faith.
meanings.sent2: The church sent an apostle to preach in distant lands.
meanings.sent3: The apostle joked that he had more frequent flyer miles than anyone else in the congregation.
meanings.sent4: She was like an apostle of kindness, always helping those in need.
meanings.sent5: The image of the apostle preaching on the mountaintop stayed with the villagers for years.

meanings.definition: A vigorous and pioneering advocate or supporter of a particular cause.
meanings.sent1: The apostle of environmental conservation led the community in tree planting.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the apostle of women's rights for her tireless efforts.
meanings.sent3: The apostle of recycling made sure every scrap of paper was reused.
meanings.sent4: He became the apostle of change, inspiring others to strive for a better future.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for education turned her into an apostle of knowledge in the town.
